channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid jabs Wales: Go-ahead for boosters and vaccines for 12-15 year olds
item.description: Both will start next week, with care residents and frontline NHS workers to get boosters first.

item.title: Boy, 9, died in Ferndale after being crushed by vehicle
item.description: Tomos Rhys Bunford died at the scene due to a blunt force injury to his chest, an inquest is told.

item.title: Llandudno goat selfie warning from coastguard
item.description: Visitors have been spotted taking selfies with the goats on the cliffs.

item.title: Gwent Police stretched with calls from worried loved ones
item.description: Experts are now sitting in control rooms helping police deal with mental health calls.

item.title: Covid vaccine would give children normality, says headmaster
item.description: As the jab is recommended for 12 to 15-year-olds, a headteacher says it would reduce disruption.

item.title: Anglesey: 'Solar farms no benefit to communities'
item.description: Filling fields with panels is similar to the flooding of Capel Celyn in the 1960s, opponents say.

item.title: Climate change: Rare birds return to Wales after bog project
item.description: Curlews and golden plovers have returned to marshland after not being seen since the 1990s.

item.title: Violence in Cardiff's Bute Park 'dark and sinister'
item.description: As well as trees destroyed, fires were started and internet and power sources cut in the park.

item.title: Former swimming coach jailed for sex assaults on children
item.description: Tom Piggot, 21, was convicted of a total of 10 offences, all of which he had denied.

item.title: Covid jabs for 12 to 15-year-olds 'for children and parents to decide'
item.description: Jab recommended for 12 to 15-year-olds but decision up to children and parents, top Welsh doctor says.

item.title: Caernarfon diving death: Body of man, 64, recovered
item.description: The man was part of a group and did not resurface at the same time as the other divers, police say.

item.title: Covid: Booster jabs for over-50s expected to be announced
item.description: A single dose of Pfizer will be offered at least six months after a second dose, the BBC understands.

item.title: 'There's no emergency service for mental health'
item.description: Mental health specialists say people do not know where to turn, so are calling the police.

item.title: The Snowdonia bogs attracting rare birds back to Wales
item.description: Curlews and golden plovers have returned to marshland after not being seen since the 1990s.

item.title: Glyn Summers fall death: Family 'can't rest' without answers
item.description: Glyn Summers' family are calling for a full public inquiry.

item.title: Cardiff: Years of work at Bute Park destroyed in attack
item.description: Police are investigating an incident which saw 50 trees damaged in an attack at a Cardiff park.

item.title: Festivals: Period facilities are needed at live events
item.description: Menstruating at lives event can be "dehumanising and daunting", festival-goers say.

item.title: Stereophonics: Cardiff gig resale ticket prices 'annoying' for band
item.description: The Welsh rockers urge fans to avoid secondary resale sites for their Christmas shows in Cardiff.

item.title: Wales and New Zealand match declared a sellout
item.description: Wales' autumn international against New Zealand in Cardiff on 30 October is declared a sellout.

item.title: Russell Martin: Swansea City boss expected to go through 'pain' at Championship club
item.description: Head coach Russell Martin says he knew there would be "pain" after taking charge at Swansea City as he tries to make his mark at the Championship club.

item.title: Paul Jones: Former Wales B and Llanelli lock dies aged 49
item.description: Former Wales B international second-row Paul Jones, who played for Llanelli, Newport and Caerphilly, dies at the age of 49.

item.title: Rubin Colwill: Cardiff City and Wales youngster's rise to prominence is gathering pace
item.description: A match-winning double at Nottingham Forest was the latest landmark day for Cardiff City teenager Rubin Colwill.

item.title: Former Wales women players say 'enough is enough' and demand action from WRU
item.description: Former players launch a petition calling for the Welsh Rugby Union to bring back elite performance pathways for girls.

item.title: Brechu plant 12-15 a brechiad pellach i rai dros 50
item.description: Mae gwaith yn mynd rhagddo eisoes, a bydd rhai yn derbyn pigiadau o'r wythnos nesaf ymlaen.

item.title: 'Ry' ni'n cael 30-40 galwad bob dydd am iechyd meddwl'
item.description: Mae arbenigwyr yn helpu ymateb i alwadau i Heddlu Gwent, a nawr maen nhw'n troi at ddiogelu plant hefyd.

item.title: Bachgen wedi marw ar ôl cael ei wasgu gan gerbyd
item.description: Bu farw Tomos Rhys Bunford, oedd yn naw oed, o "anaf difrifol i'w frest", meddai crwner.

item.title: Y ffrwyth sydd am ddim, ac ar gael nawr!
item.description: Y garddwr Adam Jones sy'n rhannu ei wybodaeth, ffeithiau a rysáit am y ffrwyth poblogaidd

item.title: Batwyr Sir Gaerloyw yn creu argraff yng Nghaerdydd
item.description: Chris Dent a Graeme van Buuren gafodd y gorau o'r ail ddiwrnod yn erbyn Morgannwg ddydd Llun.
